snippet: An index of national factory activity rose to 53.2 last month after slumping in January to 51.3, and consumer spending increased 0.4 percent in January after a 0.1 percent gain in December.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management says its index of national factory activity rose to 53.2 in February after slumping in January to 51.3; Commerce Dept says consumer spending increased 0.4 percent in January after 0.1 percent gain in December.
lead_paragraph: An index of national factory activity rose to 53.2 last month after slumping in January to 51.3, and consumer spending increased 0.4 percent in January after a 0.1 percent gain in December.

headline.main: Data Suggests Economy Is Gaining Strength
headline.print_headline: Data Suggests Economy Is Gaining Strength
